frameDefinitions: In this frame a Speaker asks an Addressee for something, or to carry out some action.
The  Speaker expresses through language his wish to get the Addressee to act in some way that will help to bring about events or states described in the Content.
A Speaker makes a commitment to an Addressee to carry out some future action.
In this frame, an Agent engages in personal body care by grooming either a Patient or a Body_part.
A Communicator announces (linguistically or non-linguistically) the  imminent arrival of an Individual or the occurrence of an Event.
A Speaker realizes a Sign, usually a linguistic one, in some Formal_realization.
frameExamples: Mr Smithers always <t>encourages</t> the employees to stay late and work harder.
You <t>promised</t> me you'd come to my graduation.
The unveiling of Alinghi's keel was <t>heralded</t> by alp horns
A person doesn't always <t>pronounce</t> a word the way they say  it in context
listRoleDefinitions: The <fen>Speaker</fen>, as in other communication frames, is generally an External Argument.
In this frame the <fen>Addressee</fen> can either occur as an NP Object (usually with a following complement clause) or as a PP Complement of verbs or nouns.
The <fen>Message</fen> is the content of the request that can be expressed as a quote, in a finite or non-finite clausal Complement, an NP Object or PP Complement.

The <fen>Medium</fen> is the physical entity or channel used to transmit the <fen>Message</fen>. The <fen>Medium</fen> is frequently expressed as a PP Complement headed by <ment>on</ment> or <ment>in</ment>.
The interval during which the <fen>Speaker</fen> makes the request.
The wish for action on the Addressee's part that the Speaker expresses.
The person that the <fen>Speaker</fen> seeks to influence to act.
The person who intends through the use of language to get another person to act.
What the communication is about.
The written or spoken material that contains a message that potentially influences the <fen>Addressee</fen> towards the <fen>Content</fen>.
An entity which the <fen>Speaker</fen> believes should participate in the action.
The time at which the lobbying occurs.
The location where the <fen>Speaker</fen> attemtps susaion on an <fen>Addressee</fen>.

The Speaker is the person who commits him/herself to do something.  Speaker is usually the External Argument of predicative uses of the target or the Genitive modifier of a noun: <fex name='Speaker'>Jo</fex> made a <t>promise</t> to me. <fex name='Speaker'>Jo</fex> <t>promised</t> me she would cook dinner. <fex name='Speaker'>Jo's</fex> <t>promise</t> to cook dinner came to nothing.

The Speaker's commitment can be made to an Addressee.  With those words which allow this frame element to be expressed, Addressee usually occurs as a PP Complement headed by <ment>to</ment> or the (Indirect) Object of verbs: Kim made a <t>promise</t> <fex name='Addressee'>to me</fex>. Kim <t>promised</t> <fex name='Addressee'>me</fex> that everything would be okay.

An expression of the commitment made by the Speaker expresses the frame element Message.  Message is expressed as a finite or non-finite clausal Complement or an NP Object: I <t>swore</t> <fex name='Message'>that I would never make the same mistake again</fex>. The owner finally <t>consented</t> <fex name='Message'>to sell the business</fex>. They <t>threatened</t> <fex name='Message'>revenge</fex>.
Topic expressions are not very frequent in this frame. They can occur with noun targets. Jo made endless <t>promises</t> <fex name='Topic'>about working harder at school</fex>.

As with other frames in the Communication domain, the <t>Medium</t> of communication may be expressed. Medium is the physical entity or channel used to transmit the Message. Bob <t>threatened</t> the workers <fex name='Medium'>in Spanish</fex>.
The time period during which the <fen>Speaker</fen> makes the commitment.
The location in which the <fen>Speaker</fen> makes the commitment.
The agent is the person who does the grooming.
The patient is the person who gets washed.
This is the region of the body that gets groomed.
This role identifies the time when the event occurs.
Where the event takes place.
The <fen>Communicator</fen> greets the arrival of an <fen>Individual</fen> or occurrence of an <fen>Event</fen>.
The person who is greeted at their arrival by the <fen>Communicator</fen>.
The occurrence which is greeted by the <fen>Communicator</fen>.
The symbol-containing artifact whereby a <fen>Communicator</fen> heralds.
This role identifies the time when the <fen>Communicator</fen>  heralds.
This role identifies the place where the Communicator heralds.
The language user who produces a <fen>Sign</fen> in some modality.
An abstract form-meaning pairing.
An evaluation of whether the <fen>Formal_realization</fen> that the <fen>Speaker</fen> produced matches the standard or standard range.
The written string, gesture, or vocalized sound sequence that the <fen>Speaker</fen> produces.
A constituent part of the <fen>Formal_realization</fen>.
The way that the <fen>Speaker</fen> produces the <fen>Formal_realization</fen>.
The time when the <fen>Speaker</fen> produces the <fen>Formal_realization</fen>.
listRoleExamples: <fex>The judge</fex> ordered the plaintiff to return the money.
The child implored <fex>her parents</fex> to let her stay up late.
The parents of the missing child made an appeal <fex>on television</fex>.

The chancellor <fex>yesterday</fex> promised to increase defence spending in real terms next
year.
The july framework has reaffirmed what was promised <fex>at Doha</fex>.
Sheep scattered from the road as trumpets heralded <fex>his arrival at the castle gates</fex>
<fex>He</fex> insists on mispronouncing my name every time, the bastard!
Finally, I would pay more attention to your 'oppinion' if you spelled it <fex>correctly</fex>.
The old uncensored editions of the Talmud referred to Jesus as Yeshua censored versions spelled it <fex>as Yeshu</fex>
You spelled it <fex>the way it sounds</fex>.
